summary: Clothe your monastic elves in the finery of the Grey Maybe
descriptionHtml:
Psijiic Greycloaks, a mod by Kohdi

-Description-
It's established lore that members of the Psijiic order have dressed in distinctive "greycloaks" for hundreds of years, at least since the time of Queen Potema. Why, then, have they suddenly decided to dishonor that tradition with a dingy yellow? This simple mod fixes that, making the yellow cloth more appropriately grey. That's it. The robes still retain their stats, their normally-unplayable status, and their mysterious spatters of mud. This is only a retexture. No .esp is included or needed. I don't plan to do anything else with this mod, I just made it today because I felt like it, so please do enjoy!

-Compatibility-
Incompatible with other Psijiic robe retextures. Aside from that feel free to do your freaky thing.

-Installation-
1. Drag the Textures folder into your Data folder (overwrite if necessary)
2. You now have grey Psijiic robes
3. Taadaa

-Uninstallation-
1. Remove the files you dragged into Textures
2. Convince yourself that you know better than someone crazy enough to make this mod
3. Realize your mistake and reinstall the mod

-F.A.Q.-
Q: What resolution are the textures? 4K with parallax I assume?
A: 2048x, sourced from the high resolution patch. No I won't downgrade them. They're visible during one single questline in the game, treat yourself.

Q: Any requirements?
A: Only your charming smile, you devil, you.

Q: Male only?
A: I retextured the female version too. No, no, hold your applause.

Q: The robes still shine like sunsets and old banana peels!
A: Make sure you extracted everything properly, it's an easy mistake to make. Also make sure you overwrite when prompted.

Q: I don't like the change, and I didn't make backups!
A: Oops. Just delete the files I gave you, things should go right back to normal.

Q: Fashion is the choice of the wearer and you shouldn't judge them for it (unless their robes are covered in pictures of fantasy babes)
A: I think you'll find a more receptive audience elsewhere.

-Credits-
Texture recoloring by myself
All other work by Bethesda

-Contact-
Leave a comment or send me a PM, I'll try to respond in a timely fashion.
author: Kohdi
